main.name: The Linux Process Manager
main.description: This is a tool that allows users to monitor and control the processes running on their system. It can display various information about the processes, such as CPU usage, memory consumption, status, etc, while performing actions on the processes, such as killing, suspending, resuming, etc.
main.bio: Use this bio section as your way of describing yourself and saying what you do, what technologies you like to use or feel most comfortable with, describing your personality, or whatever else you feel like throwing in.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

Resources.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

Sunburst.description: The CPUs contain these processes along with their children. Parent processes are at the center with their CPU utilization percentages with their children being displayed as subsequent layers with color distinguishing between process types. The width of each layer represents the CPU utilization of the group of processes in that layer.

Graph.title: Senior UX God
Graph.description: This graph combines all CPUs and displays the CPU usage over time for each CPU in a system. Each CPU is displayed with a separate line of a different color, to be able to identify CPU usage patterns across all CPUs.
